summary: This is an email exchange between Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Maria Villafaña and defense attorney Roy Black regarding the non-disclosure of a 9/24/07 agreement related to Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal. Black reassures the prosecution that Epstein and his counsel intend to honor their agreements and requests a protective order if disclosure becomes necessary.

events.title: Email Reassuring Prosecution
events.description: Roy Black emails A. Maria Villafaña to oppose disclosure of the 9/24/07 agreement in civil cases, reassure the prosecution of compliance, and request a protective order if disclosure occurs.

keyFacts: The 9/24/07 agreement related to Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal was filed under seal in state court as part of legal obligations to disclose promises or inducements.
Epstein's defense team, led by Roy Black, actively opposed disclosure of this agreement in civil cases, fearing publicity and more plaintiffs.
Roy Black reassured the U.S. Attorney's Office that Epstein and his counsel intended to stand by their agreements and requested immediate contact if any breach concerns arose.
The prosecution and defense were coordinating to keep the plea agreement details confidential, highlighting concerns about civil lawyers publicizing the case.
